body_content.explanation: in basketball, the problem of making too many fouls (= breaking the rules by hitting or making contact with the other team, giving them free chances to score), which can lead to a player being taken out of the game:
examples: The team's star forward got into foul trouble and was out of the game by the start of the fourth quarter.
The team was having foul trouble for much of the game, allowing the other team to score 14 points on free throws.
